Package common

Class Path

java.lang.Object
common.Path
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>, java.io.Serializable
Distributed filesystem paths.

Objects of type Path are used by all filesystem interfaces. Path objects are immutable.

The string representation of paths is a forward-slash-delimeted sequence of path components. The root directory is represented as a single forward slash.

The colon (:) and forward slash (/) characters are not permitted within path components. The forward slash is the delimeter, and the colon is reserved as a delimeter for application use.

See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Path

      public Path()
      Creates a new path which represents the root directory.

    • Path

      public Path​(Path path, java.lang.String component)
      Creates a new path by appending the given component to an existing path.
      Parameters:
      path - The existing path.
      component - The new component.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If component includes the separator, a colon, or component is the empty string.

    • Path

      public Path​(java.lang.String path)
      Creates a new path from a path string.

      The string is a sequence of components delimited with forward slashes. Empty components are dropped. The string must begin with a forward slash.

      Parameters:
      path - The path string.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the path string does not begin with a forward slash, or if the path contains a colon character.

  • Method Details

    • iterator

      public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the components of the path.

      The iterator cannot be used to modify the path object - the remove method is not supported.

      Specified by:
      iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
      Returns:
      The iterator.

    • list

      public static Path[] list​(java.io.File directory) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Lists the paths of all files in a directory tree on the local filesystem.
      Parameters:
      directory - The root directory of the directory tree.
      Returns:
      An array of relative paths, one for each file in the directory tree.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the root directory does not exist.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If directory exists but does not refer to a directory.

    • isRoot

      public boolean isRoot()
      Determines whether the path represents the root directory.
      Returns:
      true if the path does represent the root directory, and false if it does not.

    • parent

      public Path parent()
      Returns the path to the parent of this path.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the path represents the root directory, and therefore has no parent.

    • last

      public java.lang.String last()
      Returns the last component in the path.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the path represents the root directory, and therefore has no last component.

    • isSubpath

      public boolean isSubpath​(Path other)
      Determines if the given path is a subpath of this path.

      The other path is a subpath of this path if is a prefix of this path. Note that by this definition, each path is a subpath of itself.

      Parameters:
      other - The path to be tested.
      Returns:
      true If and only if the other path is a subpath of this path.

    • toFile

      public java.io.File toFile​(java.io.File root)
      Converts the path to File object.
      Parameters:
      root - The resulting File object is created relative to this directory.
      Returns:
      The File object.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      Compares two paths for equality.

      Two paths are equal if they share all the same components.

      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      other - The other path.
      Returns:
      true if and only if the two paths are equal.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code of the path.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the path to a string.

      The string may later be used as an argument to the Path(String) constructor.

      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the path.
